page.title: 12Children's "in words"
page.content: Children all around the country develop a set of words that they use when with their friends, especially at school. We are not sure why they start to use the words, perhaps they come from TV characters. Words used to express approval in this area have been{"that's brill", {"ace", "cool",}but the latest favourite is{"mega".}Children accepted as "in with the bunch" are{"ace kids" or{"cool dudes". Children also pick up on sayings they hear from their parents and older folk.{"Kids today!"}was often uttered by children when their friends were being silly.{"Don't cry about it"}is a reply to anyone complaining about the unfairness of the situation they found themselves in. Names they call each other are less suitable for the general public!
